Intro.text:
In infants, do NOT use oral lidocaine due to risk of methemoglobinemia and FDA black box warning
[1]
[2]

Background.text:
Some experts recommend Magic Mouthwash / oral
Lidocaine
in children if not tolerating PO intake, although evidence suggests no better than placebo
[3]

Warnings.text:
DO NOT EXCEED dosing limits especially for
lidocaine
.
DO NOT use under 2 years old
Never give a family an amount that can be toxic if unintentionally swallowed in its entirety

Lidocaine.text:
1 cc Viscous 2% lidocaine = 20mg lidocaine
Max dose = 5mg/kg
For a 10 kg child = 50mg lidocaine = 2.5 cc

Diphenhydramine.text:
Diphenhydramine
6.25mg/5cc or 12.5mg/5cc
Max dose = 5mg/kg/day
For a 10 kg child = 50mg benadryl =20 cc of 12.5mg/5cc
